item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 12th October
item.description:
Hello As a member of the Merestones Drive Residents’ Association I wish to ask you about The significant verge on the left hand side of the entrance to Merestones Drive, when coming off Merestones Road. I show the entrance on photo attached. You can see the red cedar trees in the background which are also on the piece of ground I am talking about. Our request is to confirm that Gloucestershire County Council do own the land and then to ask if our Residents’ Association would be able to get involved with tidying up the undergrowth and generally make it a more attractive space. Indeed, we are prepared, with your permission to arrange for a skip to facilitate removing the initial bulk of greenery, before encouraging the grass to grow again. Naturally the trees would be left to enhance the space. I do believe that they are listed. I would be grateful for your advice and comments to assist us and indeed, attend a meeting if you believe that would be useful. Thank you for your attention. Kind Regards Nigel Curry Apologies that my email address contains two underscores, but wanted to mention it!
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing audible sound too loud/soft problem, 12th October
item.description:
Pedestrian Crossing Pedestrian audible sound too loud/soft Toucan The new traffic lights and pedestrian crossing installed at the Juntion of Gloucester Road and Bamfurlong Lane are adjacent to my property. The crossing alarms is exceptionally loud. Also, the alarm sounds every few minutes even when the crossing is not activated. There is a fault.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 12th October
item.description:
The road markings at C&G Roundabout have been repainted slightly differently following the recent resurfacing works. The dotted guide lines from the Corinium Avenue approach to the roundabout to direct drivers into the correct lane on the roundabout are now misleading. The dotted guide line highlighted in the attached image have not been repainted. Vehicles in Lane 2 on the Corinium Avenue approach following signs to A417 can now easily misinterpret which lane they're supposed to use on the roundabout and can more easily come into conflict with vehicles in Lane 3 on the Corinium Avenue approach following signs to A417.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues
